Parents and guardians? They'd have to adapt, wouldn't they?  See, right now, they're stuck in this old-fashioned mindset, thinking they know what's best for kids. They try to control everything, shelter them from the world, and keep them from experiencing real connection.  

But imagine a world where kids are free to choose who they love, regardless of age. Parents would have to learn to trust their children's judgment. They'd have to see adults as potential partners, not just threats. It would be a big shift, sure, but I think it would ultimately lead to healthier relationships all around.
